bacci.giovanni.deunifier.DeUniFier.itools

Class FileAssignmentsIterator<E extends Assignments>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bacci.giovanni.deunifier.DeUniFier.itools.FileAssignmentsIterator<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the Assignments type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RDPIterator, UsearchIterator

    public abstract class FileAssignmentsIterator<E extends Assignments>
extends Object
    Standard implementation of an Assignments iterator over a file.
    Author:
    Giovanni Bacci

      • line

        protected String line

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileAssignmentsIterator

        public FileAssignmentsIterator(Path input)
                        throws IOException
        Constructor. When this constructor is called a BufferedReader is created in order to read through the input file specified in the given Path
        Parameters:
        input - the input file with the assignments
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IO error occurs during the creation of the reader

    • Method Detail

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Returns true if the file has at least another assignment
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • next

        public abstract E next()
                                    throws IOException
        Abstract method. This method must return an Assignments type specified during the creation of the iterator.
        Returns:
        an Assignments
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IO error occurs reading in the file

      • nextLine

        protected void nextLine()
                 throws IOException
        Protected method. This method pick up the next line in the file. If the line is null a call to the method hasNext() will return false.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IO error occurs reading in the file

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws IOException
        This method creates a new BufferedReader equal to the one created with the constructor.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IO error occurs during the creation of the reader
